data.title: Member States - Guyana
data.meta_description: The Latin American and Caribbean Economic System (SELA) is a regional intergovernmental organization that groups 26 Latin American and Caribbean countries. With headquarters in Caracas, Venezuela, SELA was established on 17 October 1975 by the Panama Convention and its current membership includes Argentina, Bahamas, Barbados, Belize, Bolivia, Brazil, Colombia, Cuba, Chile, Ecuador, El Salvador, Guatemala, Guyana, Haiti, Honduras, Jamaica, Mexico, Nicaragua, Panama, Paraguay, Peru, Dominican Republic, Suriname, Trinidad & Tobago, Uruguay and Venezuela.
data.text:
Official name: Co-operative Republic of Guyana

Short name: Guyana

Date of membership: 17 January 1976

Capital: Georgetown

Government

Administrative divisions: 10 regions: Barima-Waini, Cuyuni-Mazaruni, Demerara-Mahaica, East Berbice-Corentyne, Essequibo Islands-West Demerara, Mahaica-Berbice, Pomeroon-Supenaam, Potaro-Siparuni, Upper Demerara-Berbice, Upper Takutu-Upper Essequibo.

Independence: 26 May 1966 (from UK)

Constitution: 6 October 1980

Suffrage: 16 years of age; universal

Executive branch: Chief of state: President Donald Ramotar (since 03 December 2011).

Head of government: Prime Minister Samuel Hinds (since October 1992, except for a period as chief of state after the death of President Cheddi Jagan on 6 March 1997.

Cabinet: Cabinet of Ministers appointed by the president, responsible to the legislature. Prime minister appointed by the president.

Legislative branch: Unicameral National Assembly (68 seats, 65 elected by popular vote, 1 elected Speaker of the National Assembly, and 2 nonvoting members appointed by the president; members serve five-year terms).

Judicial branch: Supreme Court of Judicature; Judicial Court of Appeal; High Court.

Internet country code: .gy

Official Portal Web: http://www.op.gov.gy

Geography

Location: Northern South America, bordering the North Atlantic Ocean, between Suriname and Venezuela.

Area: 214,970 sq km

Land boundaries: 2,462 km

Border countries: Brazil 1,119 km, Suriname 600 km, Venezuela 743 km

Coastline: 459 km

Natural resources: Bauxite, gold, diamonds, hardwood timber, shrimp, fish

Environment - international agreements: Party to: Biodiversity, Climate Change, Climate Change-Kyoto Protocol, Desertification, Endangered Species, Hazardous Wastes, Law of the Sea, Ozone Layer Protection, Ship Pollution, Tropical Timber 83, Tropical Timber 94.

Economic indicators

Total at current prices (2013) 3555 Millions USD 2017 Per capita at current prices 4571 USD 2017 Growth rate per capita at constant prices 1.6 % 2017 Country share in regional GDP 0.1 % 2017 Imports of goods and services (% of GDP at current prices) NA NA NA Exports of goods and services (% of GDP at current prices) NA NA NA

Source: Guyana: National Economic Profile. CEPALSTAT. Databases and Statistical Publications. ECLAC. On line. Inquiry: July 07, 2019. NA= Data not avilable
